subject: Politics
title: Presidential Systems
description: A short lesson to help you apply Presidential Systems.

hook.text: The US president can't be fired by Congress. That independence is a feature â€” and sometimes a problem.

buildup.text: Presidential systems separate executive and legislature. Each branch has its own electoral mandate.

discovery.text: The president serves a fixed term regardless of legislative support. Stability is the design goal.

twist.text: But gridlock follows. When the president and legislature disagree, nothing moves for years.

climax.text: Latin America adopted presidential systems widely. Many collapsed into authoritarian rule.

punchline.text: Presidents are hard to remove. That's both a strength and a risk.

quiz.question: What is the main downside of presidential systems?
options: Gridlock when the president and legislature disagree
Presidents are too easy to remove
They don't exist outside the US
